page.title: 19Edgcott Cottages, Exford
page.content: 2 Edgcott Cottage was built in 1841 by Thomas Pearce.In the late 1800's it was a grocers shop. The next door cottage was East Edgcott Homestead Farm. This was the butchers shop and animals for slaughtering were kept in the field behind called Butchers Field. The slaughtering was done in the barn next door.We bought 2 Edgcott in 1981 which we modernised,Many cottages on Exmoor are modernised and sold for holiday homes.Our cottage was built with the field halfway up the side of the wall, this made it very damp. We overcame this by purchasing a strip of the field next door which was excavated making our driveway and entrance to our back door. The old Kitchen and bathroom were demolished and new ones built.This has resulted in a much improved cottage.
